title: Lost email
content:
In a moment of stupidity while updating Thunderbird to the new one, I clicked the wrong button. Everything looked OK and after checking it, I let my IOBit Uninstaller get rid of excess files. It got rid of all of them. I may still be able to get them back, however in the setup your existing email, it won't log in. It finds the configuration, income and outgoing and username. But then comes back with the ERROR Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, user name or password. I only have one account and it is also loaded on my laptop. However, that doesn't help me much as I hadn't used the laptop for months until this happened. Why won't it log in? Looks the same as the laptop in settings. My restore points don't work. It has not been my day.

So, how do I get it to log in? I really need that email back. Thanks Tori (who will back and save on a stick forever now)

title: Contact information deleted during edit
content:
I was editing a contact synced by TBSync from a gmail account.

I created a new note section and added some information that included ":" and newlines.

After saving, only the first line was saved. I tried to edit again to add the information a few times without success, then the entire contact was wiped of information, but still existed.

The blank contact can still be searched by the original name, so something still existed there.

After a restart, the contact is completely gone.

I created a new contact and tried to reproduce the problem by entering similar information, but had no further problem.

Mostly, I just wanted to log this event in case others have the problem.

title: Connecting to Outgoing server (SMTP) outbound.att.net failed
content:
Thunderbird will no longer send E-Mail but still works for incoming E-Mail. It provides the following error message:

Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because connecting to Outgoing server (SMTP) outbound.att.net failed. The server may be unavailable or is refusing SMTP connections. Please verify that your Outgoing server (SMTP) settings are correct and try again.

The Outgoing server is configured as follows: AT&T / outbound.att.net / 465 / SSL/TLS / Normal Password / E-Mail

This configuration has not been changed in years. Everything I can find on line suggests this configuration should still work. Any suggestions you could provide would be appreciated.

Tom
creator: tvmacek
